# Credits and Attribution

## ENTE-TCP Development

**Author:** ENTE-TCP Development Team (@hejhdiss)  
**GitHub:** https://github.com/hejhdiss  
**Generated by:** Claude Sonnet 4.5 (Anthropic AI)  
**Date:** February 2025

## Original Work

This project is based on **NDM-TCP** (Neural Differential Manifolds TCP):
- **Repository:** https://github.com/hejhdiss/lkm-ndm-tcp
- **Original Author:** @hejhdiss
- **Concept:** Using neural networks and entropy for TCP congestion control

## What ENTE-TCP Is

ENTE-TCP is a **simplified, ML-free version** of NDM-TCP that:
- Removes all neural network components
- Keeps the core entropy-based congestion detection
- Makes the algorithm transparent and understandable
- Uses only classical if-else logic for decision making

## Code Generation

All code in this repository was generated by **Claude Sonnet 4.5**, an AI assistant by Anthropic, based on the NDM-TCP implementation. The generation process involved:

1. Analyzing the original NDM-TCP kernel module
2. Identifying core entropy calculation logic
3. Removing neural network layers, weights, and learning mechanisms
4. Simplifying decision logic to pure entropy thresholds
5. Adding extensive documentation and comments
6. Creating build system and comprehensive README

## Acknowledgments

### Core Concepts
- Shannon Entropy for information theory
- TCP congestion control principles
- RTT variance analysis for network state detection

### Inspiration
- The insight that entropy can distinguish noise from congestion
- NDM-TCP's innovative approach to wireless network handling
- Modern challenges in mobile/wireless TCP performance

### Tools
- Linux kernel TCP congestion control framework
- Claude Sonnet 4.5 for code generation and documentation
- Open source community contributions to TCP research

## How to Cite

If you use ENTE-TCP in academic work or research:

```bibtex
@software{ente_tcp_2025,
  title={ENTE-TCP: Entropy-Enhanced TCP Congestion Control},
  author={{ENTE-TCP Development Team}},
  year={2025},
  note={Simplified from NDM-TCP by Claude Sonnet 4.5},
  url={https://github.com/hejhdiss/lkm-ndm-tcp},
  license={GPL-2.0}
}
```

Please also cite the original NDM-TCP:

```bibtex
@software{ndm_tcp_2024,
  title={NDM-TCP: Neural Differential Manifolds for TCP Congestion Control},
  author={@hejhdiss},
  year={2024},
  url={https://github.com/hejhdiss/lkm-ndm-tcp},
  license={GPL-2.0}
}
```

## Disclaimer

This code was generated by an AI system (Claude Sonnet 4.5) and should be:
- Thoroughly tested before production use
- Reviewed for security and correctness
- Used at your own risk
- Validated in your specific network environment

While generated with care and extensive commenting, AI-generated code may contain bugs or unexpected behavior. Always test in a controlled environment first.
